title: B5084.pdf
content:
actors  are surrounding conditions both within the house and 
outside the house in which one lives. These include cleanliness, ventilation, water 
drainage, garbage disposal, availability of safe drinking water and environmental 
sanitation.  Water refers to water supply systems, which include sources of water, water treatment and transportation of water. Environmental sanitation includes the air we breathe, soil conditions, road conditions, traffic, order and cleanliness 
of the community.
 We see, therefore, how our health is affected by our own behaviour and environment. What and how we eat, how we exercise, how we behave and 
manage our emotions are in turn linked with the environment we live in as well 
as  socio-economic and geographic factors such as education, financial status, cultures, social habits, nature of occupation, etc. 
Now, what can we do to keep ourselves, our families and our community in good 
health?
